page.title: 02THE CATHEDRAL, LINCOLN.
page.content: The {Normans }started building the Cathedral in{1072.}A fire and an earth -quake destroyed most of the Norman structure and it was rebuilt by{St. {Hugh 1186-1200.}In {1311}the {central {tower}was completed and is reputed to be the highest point heading eastwards until the {Ural Mountains}are reached. The Cathedral provides worship, drama, music and exhibitions throughout the year. Visitors come to see to see the architecture, especially the Norman {West Front, }and the two stained glass windows - the{" Dean's Eye "}and the {"Bishop's Eye".}The{ Wren }Library and the {Treasury }contain many valuables including one of the four original copies of the {Magna Carta.}On most nights of the year the Cathedral is {floodlit.}If you look carefully inside you may find the{Lincoln Imp.
